body:
Generally, gofmt -s only simplifies if there's near universal agreement that the simpler form is "better". This is pretty clear for say for "a, _ = range x" which becomes "a = range x", etc.

Also, if code is under development, simplifying the select may not be desirable.

I have long advocated a -ss mode ("strong simplify") which could do things like this (and more); and which wouldn't be restricted as much as "-s".
